moves.1. f4:
The Bird Opening Move....... this kind of opening are seldomly used by top
rated players. But who knows what contains in this "Bird".
moves.1... d5: The natural answer which is usually created to fight for the center squares.
moves.2. Nf3: Preventing the e5 thrust from the opponent.
moves.2... Bg4: This move helps black to neutralize the centre squares (.....Bxf3, then ......e5)
moves.3. e3: Just in case ......Bxf3, if not, doubled pawns will be occur and that sucks
moves.3... Nd7: Normal move order...... see it?, to support the e5 thrust again.
moves.4. b3: Normal continuation for Bird opening move, this black squared bishop is too strong here.
moves.4... e6:
....e6?!, a dubious move. After all the supporting moves, black came up with
this one. Hmmm....... remember the topic.
moves.5... Ngf6 6. d3: Preventing .....Ne4, and a spot for white's knight .... 7. Nbd2.
moves.6... Bd6: Black readies his castling thus putting the bishop into good square.
moves.7. h3: Provoking black to capture the f3 knight. .....Bh5 is bad
moves.7... Bxf3 8. Qxf3 O-O: The king looks safe right....... wait in a few moves.
moves.9. Nd2 c6 10. g4:
White is transposing to the "Polar Bear System" (invented and deeply
analyzed by GM Henrik Danielsen from Poland)
moves.12. g5: Black should try other moves like .....Nh7
moves.12... hxg5 13. hxg5 Ne8 14. Qh5: The KILLER move appears....... now, what else can black do here
moves.14... f6: To make some breathing space for his King..... nope TOO LATE!!!!
moves.15. g6: After this move, black resigned because it's all over now

gameName: Don't judge the book by its cover
